016package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day01;
017
018import static com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.Presentation.NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT;
019
020import com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.DataSource;
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.util.Map;
023import java.util.regex.Matcher;
024import java.util.regex.Pattern;
025import java.util.stream.Stream;
026
027/**
028 * Implements solutions for parts 1 and 2 of day 1&mdash;that is, reading and analyzes a sequence
029 * of lines of text, extracting a 2-digit integer comprising the first and last digits that appear
030 * in the line from each, and then summing those numbers.
031 * <p>Parts 1 and 2 of the problem differ in what qualifies as a digit:</p>
032 * <ul>
033 *   <li>In part 1, the only digits recognized are the characters 0..9 from the base-10
034 *   Indo-Arabic numerals. The method using this rule is {@link #sumDigits()}.</li>
035 *   <li>In part 2, the digit characters 0..9 are recognized, along with the words spelling them
036 *   out: "zero", "one", "two", "three", etc. The method employing this relaxed definition is
037 *   {@link #sumDigitWords()}.</li>
038 * </ul>
039 * <p>In both cases, the first and last digits aren't necessarily distinct. For example, in a line
040 * comprising simply "9", 9 is both the first digit and the last digit; the resulting 2-digit number
041 * for that line would be 99. Similarly, digit words (in part 2) may overlap. For example in the
042 * line "oneight", the first digit is 1, represented by the word "one", and the last is 8,
043 * represented by "eight".</p>
044 *
045 * @see <a href="https://adventofcode.com/2023/day/1">"Day 1: Trebuchet?!"</a>.
046 */
047public class Trebuchet {
048
049  private static final String NON_DIGITS_PATTERN = "\\D";
050  private static final Pattern FIRST_DIGIT_OR_WORD_EXTRACTOR =
051      Pattern.compile("^.*?((\\d)|zero|one|two|three|four|five|six|seven|eight|nine).*$");
052  private static final Pattern LAST_DIGIT_OR_WORD_EXTRACTOR =
053      Pattern.compile("^.*((\\d)|zero|one|two|three|four|five|six|seven|eight|nine).*$");
054  private static final Map<String, Integer> DIGIT_WORDS = Map.of(
055      "zero", 0,
056      "one", 1,
057      "two", 2,
058      "three", 3,
059      "four", 4,
060      "five", 5,
061      "six", 6,
062      "seven", 7,
063      "eight", 8,
064      "nine", 9
065  );
066
067  private final String inputFile;
068
069  /**
070   * Initializes this instance, using the value of {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} as the name
071   * (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read. In other
072   * words, using this constructor is equivalent to using
073   * {@link #Trebuchet(String) Trebuchet(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE)}.
074   */
075  public Trebuchet() {
076    this(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE);
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Initializes this instance, using the value specified in the {@code inputFile} parameter as the
081   * name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read.
082   *
083   * @param inputFile Classpath/package-relative location of file from which input is read.
084   */
085  public Trebuchet(String inputFile) {
086    this.inputFile = inputFile;
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Creates an instance of {@link Trebuchet} for each of the two parts of the problem, implicitly
091   * specifying that input should be read from the file specified in
092   * {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}, and invoking the relevant method to compute the required
093   * value, which is then printed to the console.
094   *
095   * @param args Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
096   * @throws IOException If the input file specified (implicitly or explicitly) in the constructor
097   *                     invocation cannot be found or read.
098   */
099  public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
100    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 1, new Trebuchet().sumDigits());
101    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 2, new Trebuchet().sumDigitWords());
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Reads each line of the input file (as specified in the constructor invocation, or
106   * {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} if the {@link #Trebuchet()} constructor is used),
107   * extracts the first digit found in the line (reading left-to-right) and the last digit found (or
108   * the first found, reading right-to-left), combines them to form a two-digit integer, and returns
109   * the sum of these.
110   * <p>This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.</p>
111   *
112   * @return The sum of two-digit numbers extracted from the input.
113   * @throws IOException If the input file specified (implicitly or explicitly) in the constructor
114   *                     invocation cannot be found or read.
115   */
116  public int sumDigits() throws IOException {
117    try (Stream<String> lines = DataSource.simpleLines(inputFile, this)) {
118      return lines
119          .map((line) -> line.replaceAll(NON_DIGITS_PATTERN, ""))
120          .map((line) -> line.charAt(0) + line.substring(line.length() - 1))
121          .mapToInt(Integer::parseInt)
122          .sum();
123    }
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Reads each line of the input file (as specified in the constructor invocation, or
128   * {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} if the {@link #Trebuchet()} constructor is used),
129   * extracts the first digit character or digit word found in the line (reading left-to-right) and
130   * the last digit character or digit word found (or the first found, reading right-to-left),
131   * combines them to form a two-digit integer, and returns the sum of these.
132   * <p>This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.</p>
133   *
134   * @return The sum of two-digit numbers extracted from the input.
135   * @throws IOException If the input file specified (implicitly or explicitly) in the constructor
136   *                     invocation cannot be found or read.
137   */
138  public int sumDigitWords() throws IOException {
139    try (Stream<String> lines = DataSource.simpleLines(inputFile, this)) {
140      return lines
141          .mapToInt(this::getCalibrationValue)
142          .sum();
143    }
144  }
145
146  private int getCalibrationValue(String line) {
147    Matcher firstMatcher = FIRST_DIGIT_OR_WORD_EXTRACTOR.matcher(line);
148    Matcher lastMatcher = LAST_DIGIT_OR_WORD_EXTRACTOR.matcher(line);
149    if (!firstMatcher.matches() || !lastMatcher.matches()) {
150      throw new IllegalArgumentException();
151    }
152    return 10 * value(firstMatcher) + value(lastMatcher);
153  }
154
155  private int value(Matcher matcher) {
156    String digitCapture = matcher.group(2);
157    return (digitCapture != null)
158        ? Character.getNumericValue(digitCapture.charAt(0))
159        : DIGIT_WORDS.get(matcher.group(1));
160  }
161
162}
